column2: ENGLISH

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Ruthenian culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Ukrainian.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
Welcome into the fold, my Ukrainian brothers and sisters.

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Ruthenian culture. They have begun to refer to themselves as Russian.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
Welcome into the fold, my Russian brothers and sisters.
The people of [Root.GetName] came to the point where they can no longer consider themselves as a part of the tribe. Now they are Ruthenians.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
Welcome into the fold, my Ruthenian brothers and sisters.
Hard times have come!

Our traditions are fading, foreign preachers speak of this new 'Christ God'.
See for yourself my chief, tribes are falling apart, honoured ways of living, our very traditions are being forsaken!
To the west the mighty Christian kingdoms seek to bring ruin to our lands and horrors to our people!To the east savage hordes of riders who worship the Sky seek to enslave us! And to the north our oldest foes, the Varangians who raid and plunder at our expense... but perhaps they can be persuaded to plunder the hated Christ-worshipers instead?
If we are to survive these dark times my chief, we must stand as one people, you must bring us together as one heart, one soul! Only then we can stand the test of time and pave our own way through history on our terms.
May the Gods protect us!
We will fight with honour.
The Tribe Will Stand!

Despite all problems we stand the test of time.\nOur brethren have developed our own language and customs to a point where we are no longer considered one of primitive tribes.\nWe proved to ourselves and the whole world that we are a mighty nation.
Let us see what future holds for our tribe.
The Tribe Forgotten!
Our tribe failed the test of time.\nOur brethren united with neighboring East Slavs and became one big family. From now on we are the part of something bigger then just a tribe.\nWe are Ruthenians.
It is time to move on and build a civilized Slavic nation.
The Tribe Forgotten!
Our tribe failed the test of time.\nOur brethren united with neighboring East Slavs and became one big family. From now on we are the part of something bigger then just a tribe.\nWe are Ruthenians.
It is time to move on and build a civilized Slavic nation.
The people of [Root.GetName] came to the point where they can no longer consider themselves as a part of the tribe. Now they are Ruthenians.
Welcome into the fold, my Ruthenian brothers and sisters.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
My advisors told me that the lords are prosperous and can handle an additional tribute. Should I demand it or not?
I will demand more tribute!
There is no need to inconvenience them.
I will take all they have!Triple tribute!
My advisors told me that people of [Root.GetName] had a good harvest this year and can handle an additional tribute. Should I demand it or not?
I will demand more tribute!
There is no need to inconvenience them.
I will take all they have! Triple tribute!
One of my vassals wants to judge a man with traditional laws of his culture. In my culture there is different punishment for such crime. Should I allow it or not?
Allow the vassal to judge according to his laws.
My land, my laws!
This case requires a unique judgement...
I don't care which law is used, just leave me alone!
People of [Root.GetName] caught a robber and want to deal with him by their cultural laws. In my culture we punish robbery under different laws. Should I stop them?
Let the crowd decide.
One land, one law, both mine.
This case requires a unique judgement...
I don't care which law is used just leave me alone!
My seer suggested to make an idol to praise the gods...
Sure, let the gods be good to us.
In the name of gods we'll make it perfect!
An idol? Nah! I can happily live without it.
There is no need to make it valuable...

The people of [Root.GetName] have developed their language and customs to a point where they may now be considered part of a distinct branch of Ruthenian culture. They have begun to refer to themselves Rusyn.
What will they think of next, I wonder.
Welcome into the fold, my Rusyn brothers and sisters.
Carpathian Rus

Finally after many years under foreign rulers our people possess their own promised land. The Rusyns rose up against foreigners' tyranny and fought back the invaders from this hills. From now on your dynasty will rule over Rusyns of all lands. We will claim our birthright on the mountains and one day all the Carpathians will belong to the rightful kingdom of Carpathian Rus.
Long live the Carpathians!
This night everyone can see a comet in the sky...
It's an Omen!
I don't fear the Gods' Wrath!
WE ARE DOOMED!
This amulet will protect you.
You are old enough to choose your Patron God.
Dazbog
Jarilo
Lada
Perun
You are old enough to choose your Patron God.
Odin
Thor
Freyja
Loki
You are old enough to choose your Patron God.
Ukko
Akka
Nnyrikki
Sappo Ilmarinen
You are old enough to choose your Patron God.
Dietas
Perkunas
Laima
Zemyna
Shia Islam

The preacher from the Far East has arrived and said:\n'Great Lord of Slavic people! The rumors about your glory comes to the farthest corners of the world. So has a word that you are seeking for the true God to believe instead of your pathetic deities. So hear my word as there is no God but Allah and Muhammad is His prophet!'\nAfter these words preacher explained all aspects of Shia Islam while you listened to him carefully.
Ahl al-Bayt
Sunni Islam

The preacher from the Far East has arrived and said:\n'Great Lord of Slavic people! Among my people there is a legend about mighty khagans of the West and now I speak to one. The great caliph has been told that you search for the true God to believe instead of old myths. So hear my word as there is no God but Allah and Muhammad is His prophet!'\nAfter these words the preacher explained all aspects of Sunni Islam while you listened to him carefully.
There is no God but Allah and Muhammad is His prophet...
Catholic Church

The preacher from Rome has arrived to your court:\n'Great Lord of Slavic people! I had a long journey to your distant land to spread the Word among your people. The Pope learned that you are ready to pray for your pagan deeds and kneel before Lord. For this I serve as the one who speaks for the Faith!'\nAnd so he began spreading the word of  Christian God in my hall and he told many stories of old times of Christ...
Deus iustus est!
Orthodox Church

The preacher from Tsargorod has arrived to your court:\n'Great Lord of Slavic people and the Emperor's closest friend! I am honored to stand before you. As soon as the words were heard that you decided to pray for your sins and kneel before Lord my heart became full of love. The love that Lord gives to all of us. So let me tell you about his miracles!'\nAnd so spread the word of loving God who forgives the sins of the penitent.
And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive our debtors...
Now I know about all of this 'One God' and need to decide which faith is true...
Christi Dei mei!
Kyrie Eleison!
Ahl al-Bayt.
There is no God but Allah and Muhammad is His prophet!
The Night to celebrate Kupala feast has come.
Allow revelry to rule here!
With sunrise Kupala Night is ending.
The celebration of youth never ends.
On this night all young people jump over the flames of bonfires in a ritual test of bravery and faith. Will you join your people?
Of course I will!
It is too dangerous.
The Lord will not spend time with commoners!
I'm getting too old for this.
On the Kupala Night all young people jump over the flames of bonfires in a ritual test of bravery and faith. Should I ask my spouse to jump with me?
Let us join, my dear!
Not this time...
I'm too old for this.
On this night all young people jump over the flames of bonfires in a ritual test of bravery and faith. Your spouse asking you to join and test your marriage.
As you wish, my love.
Not this time.
I'm too old for this.
While jumping your hands have separated. This is bad omen portends you are not meant to be together.
If the gods wants to divide us than who am I to disagree?
Some foolish belief will not separate us!
While jumping your hands have separated. This bad omen portends you are not meant to be together. My spouse decided to follow the will of Gods.
As The Gods wish...

There is an ancient belief that the eve of Kupala is the only time of the year when ferns bloom. Prosperity, luck, discernment and power would befall on whoever finds a fern flower. Many young men and women would roam through the forests. Will you join them?
I will find fern flower for my beloved!
I will find fern flower and my true love!
The fern flower is a lie so why would I search for it?
I'm too old for this.
Wandering the forest in search of the fern flower, you instead found a beautiful young woman who sits near the lake. Strange feelings well inside of you while you gaze at her...
Approach the young lady...
I am faithful to my beloved.
She's not worthy of a lord like me.
I must control my desires!
Wandering the forest in search of fern flower, you sat down at near lake to rest. The peaceful silence broke as a young man approached you. Looking at him makes you feel strange inside...
Spend the rest of night with him.
I am faithful to my beloved.
He's not worthy of a Lady like me.
A true Lady must control her desires!

After hours searching for the fern flower you begin to understand that you are lost. From the heart of the deep dark woods you hear howling and every second it draws closer. Too soon a wolf runs out of the darkness towards you!
Come closer!
I'd better run!
I will kill you with my bare hands!
You spent all night in search of fern flower and ended up with nothing but fatigue.
I guess this is not the right night.
Maybe the fern flower exists only in legends...
After spending all night in search of the mythical fern flower you see something bright under the tree. There is no doubt - you have found the fern flower!
Qui quaerit, reperit!
According to legend two souls will be bound by love if the fern flower will be shared between them...
It is for you, my dear...
This flower is for the most beautiful one.
This flower is for the most handsome one.

Veles is known to send spirits of the dead into the living world as his heralds. Festivals are held in his honour in Winter, when time is coming to its very end, when order breaks and chaos grows stronger, when the borders between worlds of living and dead fade and ancestral spirits return amongst the living.
The celebration of Velja Noc begins now!
With the last of your guests on their way back home the celebration of Velja Noc and Koliada ends.
It was good to see them all...

The celebration of Velja Noc starts with the ritual of Koliada. People gather into groups, changing their outfit for something special and walking from house to house singing the feast songs, so-called carols.
I will wear a simple outfit...
I will look like one of the gods...
I will wear my best outfit to represent myself...
I will not go...
At the end of the night the group divides all what they've been given today. Since you are a great lord it is for you to decide what to do with all of this money...
The same amount for everyone.
I will take all of money.
Give it all for charity.
The door opens and very old man stands before you. There is no debt he has nothing to offer you for the carol.
It is a celebration for everyone. Here, take this coin old man!
Let us hope his neighbours prove more generous...
If you don't have money that obviously we will take something costly in exchange!
While playing with snowballs one of kids missed his target and accidentally hit you. The surprise and shock knocked you face down into the snow. When you arose everyone laughed at you.
Nice shot kid! But what will you say about this one!
Punish this stupid kid!
You think this is funny? I'll see how you will smile in a jail!
At the end of celebration it is time to gather your family together and spend Velja Noc together...
I'm exited to see all of you again!
The feast? I like the feasts!
Uncork the best wines!
For too long have I been gone from home. The Norse manners have become strange to me. I still call myself a Varangian but I feel closer to the Slavs now than the Norse. What has happened?
I must not forget the Old Ways!
I am Rus!
The people of [Root.GetName] no longer practice true Norse ways. They still live the Varangian life but they have become... different.\nThey call themselves Rus.
A strange occurence...
A good day!
